speaker: Eric
text: Welcome. I am Eric, one of your built-in voices. And yes, you just generated me. What you are hearing right now is entirely local, A I speech synthesis running on your own machine.

speaker: Eric
text: This is Qwen Three T T S Pro Suite. It gives you three distinct creative engines: Custom Voice for pre-trained speakers, Voice Design for inventing new characters from scratch, and Voice Clone for replicating any voice from a short audio sample.

speaker: Ryan
text: Hey! I am Ryan. And I am also built in. Notice how different we sound? Same engine, same model, completely different identity. The Custom Voice tab gives you nine of us to choose from, across English, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.

speaker: Eric
text: Now look to the right side of the window. That is the Session History panel. Every take you generate is automatically logged there in real time. You can replay, delete, rename, or export any take from that list at any time.

speaker: Eric
text: Right-clicking any entry in the history gives you more options. You can save it as a W A V file, convert it to M P 3, or even set it as the app's notification sound for when a long generation finishes.

speaker: Ryan
text: This tutorial series has sixteen chapters, and each one loads directly into the Batch Studio as a playable script. We will walk you through every feature, from the basic controls right up to the pro-level tools.

speaker: Eric
text: When you are ready, go to the Tutorial tab, select Chapter Two: U I Overview, and click Load Tutorial Script. Then click Run Scene to continue.
